conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_A is my first-choice school. I’m applying because your academic focus and overall environment match what I’m looking for, and I would be ready to commit and enroll if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), early application is still best because capacity is 1 and other students may target it. If I delay, I risk losing my first choice without gaining anything. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to increase the chance they pick me if higher-priority students don’t apply or later switch.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_A as your first choice. At this time, we are not able to offer you admission. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is 3rd on School_A’s true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D). In round 1, only Student_A has applied to us, but Student_B ranks School_A 3rd (likely applies to School_B first) and Student_D ranks School_A 2nd (likely applies to School_C first). Since we have quota 1, accepting Student_A now would lock us in and prevent matching with higher-priority students if they later apply. Given the early round and the likelihood that higher-priority students may become available, it is strategically better to reject now and keep capacity open.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_B and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your program and will commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying immediately gives me the best chance to secure the seat before higher-priority students commit elsewhere. I will make a clear, committed application emphasizing strong fit and willingness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your commitment and would be happy to welcome you to School_B. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is applying to us as their 1st choice. On our true priority list, Student_B is ranked 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A). Given the market, Student_D is the top priority for multiple schools (notably School_D and School_A), and Student_A’s top choice is School_A; neither is likely to apply to us immediately. Student_E may apply to us as their 2nd choice but is our last priority. With quota 1, accepting Student_B now secures a relatively high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending up with a lower-ranked student or remaining unmatched if higher-ranked students never approach us.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_D. School_C is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the academic environment and community you offer. I would be honored to enroll if given the opportunity, and I’m ready to commit immediately. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd after Student_C and Student_B). Since capacity is 1 and competition is likely, I should apply immediately rather than just talk, and clearly express that School_C is my first choice to encourage acceptance if they are considering close candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_C. If you are ready to commit, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Congratulations,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority ranks Student_D (3rd) above Student_E (4th). In this round, only D and E applied. Accepting Student_D now secures a higher-priority match and uses my single quota. Although Student_C (my top choice) and Student_B (2nd) might appear in later rounds, they both rank School_C low (4th and 5th respectively) and are likely to apply elsewhere first, making it risky to wait. Student_D lists School_C as first choice, so acceptance is likely stable and optimal given current information.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_E. School_C is my first choice because I’m looking for a strong academic environment and a community where I can contribute consistently. If admitted, I would enroll and prioritize School_C. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, so I should pursue it immediately. However, School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_C, Student_B, Student_D), and those students also have School_C relatively high (A: 2nd, D: 1st, B: 5th, C: 4th). Competition is likely, so I should still apply now to secure a chance if higher-priority students go elsewhere, while signaling strong fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re unable to offer you admission in this round.

We appreciate your consideration of School_C and wish you the very best with your remaining applications.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and already matched with Student_D this round via [ACCEPT], leaving remaining quota 0. Rules require rejecting any further [APPLY] when quota is 0. Although Student_E is on School_C's true priority list (ranked above Student_A but below Student_D), we cannot accept without capacity, so must reject.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions committee. I’m Student_C and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m especially interested in your academic environment and would be excited to contribute positively to the community. I would like to formally apply for your available seat.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, so I should apply immediately. School_D’s priority list ranks me (Student_C) 3rd, so I have a realistic chance if higher-priority students (Student_D, Student_E) apply elsewhere or are rejected. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before capacities fill.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_D as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We believe you would be a strong fit for our academic community and look forward to having you join us.
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority is D > E > C > B > A. Student_C is my 3rd choice, and they have applied with School_D as their first choice, making acceptance likely to secure a match immediately. However, higher-priority students Student_D and Student_E may approach later: Student_D ranks School_D last, so is very unlikely to apply here; Student_E ranks School_D 4th, also unlikely unless rejected elsewhere. Given the round is 1 and my quota is 1, holding out risks ending unmatched, while accepting Student_C yields a solid (top-3) outcome with high stability because Student_C prefers me most. Therefore I should accept.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Team,

I’m Student_E, and I’m writing to formally apply for your remaining seat. School_A is one of my top choices because I’m seeking a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to contribute steadily to the school community through consistent effort and participation.

If offered admission, I would accept promptly and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_A is ranked higher than School_E, so I should apply to School_A first. I also note School_A’s priority list places me above Student_C, so if Student_C is still searching, I have a reasonable chance. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and willingness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. After reviewing your application, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_A.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A’s true priority is B > D > A > E > C. Student_E is acceptable but ranks 4th. In round 1, Student_A (rank 3) applied and was rejected; that reduced our chance to fill with a higher-priority candidate. However, Student_B (rank 1) prefers School_B first and School_D second; Student_D (rank 2) prefers School_C first; Student_C prefers School_D first. Given other schools’ priorities, Student_B is highly desired by School_B and may be matched there; Student_D is top for School_B and School_D and may be taken quickly; Student_C is top for School_C and may go there or to School_D. Waiting risks ending unmatched. With only one seat and a credible commitment from Student_E, accepting now secures a filled seat with an acceptable student rather than gambling on higher-ranked students who are unlikely to come to School_A soon.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A. I would like to formally apply to School_E. I’m looking for a school where I can contribute consistently in class and be an engaged member of the community, and I’m ready to commit and enroll if accepted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_E remain unmatched. School_A is my top choice but already rejected me, and its priority list ranks me behind Student_B and Student_D, so acceptance is unlikely unless circumstances change. School_E is on my preference list (last), and importantly School_E ranks me #1 in its priority list, giving me the best chance to secure a match now rather than risk being left unmatched. I will apply to School_E with a clear commitment message.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your commitment to enroll if accepted. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We believe you will be a strong contributor to our classrooms and community, and we look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_E's true priority list, and we have quota 1 with no current matches. Although Student_A ranks School_E last in their preferences, they have submitted an [APPLY] with an explicit commitment to enroll if accepted, so there is no strategic benefit to delaying. Accepting secures our top-choice student immediately and dominates any alternative outcome (waiting risks losing them without any upside because no student outranks Student_A on our list).
